newsitem.title: USA: Federated selling three Macy's stores to Dillard.
newsitem.headline: Federated selling three Macy's stores to Dillard.

text.p: Federated Department Stores Inc. said Friday it agreed to sell three Macy's stores in Houston to Dillard Department Stores Inc.
Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.
It said the deal, involving stores in the Baybrook, Deerbrook and Willowbrook malls, is expected to close in the second quarter.

Michael Steinberg, chairman of Federated's Macy's West operation, said the sale would allow the division to focus on more productive Texas stores, the Dallas Galleria and Houston Galleria, and a new store in San Antonio due to open in May.
The San Francisco-based division, with 1996 sales of $3.7 billion, operates 109 stores in Arizona, California, Minnesota, Nevada, New Mexico and Texas.
Federated, with corporate offices in Cincinnati and New York, is the nation's largest department store retailer, with annual sales of more than $15 billion.
It has more than 400 department stores and 150 speciality stores in 36 states, under the names of Bloomingdale's, The Bon Marche, Burdines, Goldsmith's, Lazarus, Macy's, Rich's and Stern's.
Dillard, based in Little Rock, Ark., operates about 250 stores in 24 states.
Federated stock fell 25 cents to $34.625 while Dillard shares rose 25 cents to $30.375, both in afternoon trading on the New York Stock Exchange.
